message.content:
cs.SI, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.DS 

Reasoning: 
- cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) is the most likely category as the paper deals with graph signal processing and inference of graph topology from observations of signals on its nodes. 
- cs.IT (Information Theory) is also likely as the paper discusses the use of eigenvectors of the covariance matrix to characterize the space of valid graphs. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning) is relevant as the paper proposes methods for selecting a particular point in the set of valid graphs under chosen criteria. 
- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) is relevant as the paper discusses the practical case of noisy observations and the convergence of the set of valid graphs as the number of observations grows. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is less likely but still possible as the paper proposes a measure to evaluate how much a graph is adapted to signals under a stationarity assumption.
